IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ENHANCE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES IN GWINNETT COUNTY, GEORGIA THROUGH AGGRESSIVE MARKETING OF HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM INDUSTRIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ENHANCE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES IN GWINNETT COUNTY, GEORGIA THROUGH AGGRESSIVE MARKETING OF HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM INDUSTRIES.
IRS990.Desc: CIVIC CENTER MANAGEMENT - THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES ASSISTANCE IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND OPERATION OF THE INFINITE ENERGY CENTER (FKA THE GWINNETT CIVIC CENTER) FOR GWINNETT COUNTY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: VISITOR'S BUREAU MANAGEMENT - OTHER EVENTS TO FURTHER ENHANCE TOURISM AND THE COMMUNITY IN GWINNETT COUNTY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AUDIT NOTE: "THE GCVB IS RECOGNIZED AS AN ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(A) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE "CODE") AS AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(6) OF THE CODE, WHEREBY ONLY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME, AS DEFINED, BY THE CODE, IS SUBJECT TO INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT EVALUATED THE GCVB'S POSITIONS AND CONCLUDED THE GCVB HAD MAINTAINED ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS AND HAD TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THEREFORE, NO PROVISION OR LIABILITY FOR INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS."

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: SUPPORT THE CHARITABLE PURPOSE OF THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANY GRANTS ARE MADE ONLY TO RECOGNIZED 501(C)(3) CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS DOING WORK IN THE GWINNETT COUNTY, GA AREA.

THE CEO AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS OF THE CONVENTION CENTER AND VISITORS BUREAU ARE PROVIDED WITH A DINING CLUB MEMBERSHIP TO THE GWINNETT CHAMBER BUILDING'S ON-SITE RESTAURANT WHICH SERVES AS A GATHERING POINT FOR GWINNETT BUSINESS PEOPLE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE GWINNETT CONVENTION AND VISITORS BUREAU IS COMPOSED OF BUSINESS, GOVERNMENT AND COMMUNITY LEADERS IN THE LOCAL AREA. DUE TO EXTENSIVE INVOLVEMENT OF THESE COMMUNITY LEADERS IN BUSINESS AND OTHER COMMUNITY AFFAIRS, THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MAY HAVE NORMAL BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS THAT MIGHT BE EXPECTED OF LEADERS IN A SUBURBAN COMMUNITY. HOWEVER, THESE BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS ARE ARMS-LENGTH TRANSACTIONS AND WILL NOT IMPACT THE MISSION OR THE OPERATION OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY REQUIRES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIOR TO THE FORM 990 BEING FILED, A DRAFT OF THE 990 IS PRESENTED AND DISCUSSED WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S TREASURER OF THE BOARD, WHO IS KNOWLEDGEABLE REGARDING THE FORM 990. THE FORM 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE TO EVERY BOARD MEMBER BEFORE THE FILING OF THE RETURN IF POSSIBLE, AND IMMEDIATELY THEREAFTER IF NOT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BASED ON THE NUMBER OF DIRECTOR'S AND SIZE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S STAFF, NO FORMAL MONITORING MECHANISM EXISTS, RATHER THE SMALL SIZE OF THE ORGANIZATION ALLOWS EMPLOYEES AND MANAGEMENT ALIKE TO KNOW WHEN ISSUES ARISE. IT IS THEN THE OBLIGATION OF THE EMPLOYEE OR MANAGER TO BRING THOSE ISSUES FORTH IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN EMPLOYMENT OR A DIRECTORSHIP POSITION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED THROUGH THE BUDGETING PROCESS AND IS APPROVED BY THE BUDGET COMMITTEE AND SUBSEQUENTLY BY THE FULL BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND INTERNAL POLICIES ARE GIVEN TO EMPLOYEES WHEN THEY ARE HIRED BY THE ORGANIZATION AND ARE AVAILABLE WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICE TO THOSE WHO FALL UNDER THEIR COVENENTS, BUT AS PROPRIETARY INFORMATION OF THE ORGANIZATION, THEY AND THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

THE PROCESS BY WHICH AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR IS CHOSEN AND THE FINANCIALS STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE THE PRIOR YEAR.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: SUGARLOAF GWINNETT CENTER LLC (A SINGLE MEMBER LLC)

IdDisregardedEntitiesGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: MANAGEMENT OF THE OPERATIONS OF THE CONVENTION CENTER

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS ASKING FOR RELIEF AND/OR ABATEMENT FROM ANY LATE FILING PENALTY AND INTEREST ASSOCIATED WITH THE 2017 FORM 990. THE LATE FILING OF THE 2017 FORM 990 HAS BEEN THE RESULT OF CIRCUMSTANCES BEYOND THE CONTROL OF THE ORGANIZATION.ON NOVEMBER 7, 2018, THE ORGANIZATION'S DIRECTOR OF FINANCE WAS KILLED IN A CAR ACCIDENT, JUST AS PREPARATION OF THE FORM 990 WAS BEING STARTED. DUE TO THE DEATH OF THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, THE INFORMATION NEEDED FROM THE ORGANIZATION TO PREPARE AND FINISH THE 2017 FORM 990 WAS DELAYED IN GETTING TO THE ACCOUNTANT PREPARING THE RETURN DUE TO A COMBINATION OF THE GRIEVING PROCESS AND PERSONNEL TAKING OVER THE DUTIES OF THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, INCLUDING THE ORGANIZATION'S BUDGETING PROCESS WHICH WAS UNDER WAY AT THE TIME, THE YEAR-END THAT WAS APPROACHING, AND THE NEED TO CLOSE OUT THE YEAR-END.IT WAS NOT THE INTENTION TO FILE THE 2017 LATE, AND GOING FORWARD IT IS THE INTENTION OF THE ORGANIZATION TO RESUME FILING ITS FORM 990 IN A TIMELY MANNER AS IT HAS DONE IN THE PAST.
